question.body: Which of the cranial nerves does not have a sensory component?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is involved in smell.
Incorrect. This is involved in vision.
Correct. This is involved only in movement of the eye.
Incorrect. While this is not a sensory only cranial nerve, it does include a sensory component for taste.
Incorrect. This is involved in hearing and equilibrium.

part.hint: Mixed cranial nerves would have both sensory and motor functions.

question.body: Which of these cranial nerves would be a mixed nerve, with both major sensory and motor functions?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is a sensory function cranial nerve.
Incorrect. This is a motor function cranial nerve.
Correct. This has both motor and sensory functions, as well as an autonomic component.
Incorrect. This is a sensory function cranial nerve.
Incorrect. This is a motor function cranial nerve.

part.hint: Several cranial nerves will have both functions, while others will be primarily only sensory or only motor.

question.body: Which of these cranial nerves would not have an autonomic function?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This controls smooth muscles that change pupil size and lens focus, so it is autonomic.
Correct. This is motor only and controls only one of the skeletal muscles of eye.
Incorrect. This controls tear and saliva production of glands, so it is autonomic.
Incorrect. This controls smooth muscle for regulation of blood pressure, so it is autonomic.
Incorrect. This controls visceral organ smooth muscle and glands, so it is autonomic.

part.hint: Autonomic would be involuntary control to smooth muscle or gland.

question.body: Which of these cranial nerves would not be involved somehow in eating?

response.feedback: Incorrect. This is involved in motor control of muscles of chewing.
Correct. This is involved in movement of eye muscles.
Incorrect. This is involved in control of salivary glands and sense of taste.
Incorrect. This is involved in muscles of swallowing and sense of taste.
Incorrect. This is involved in tongue movements.

part.hint: Eating could include chewing, producing saliva, tasting or swallowing.
